filters.title: jay i. kislak collection (library of congress)

contributor: jay i. kislak collection (library of congress)
description: "En quatro decadas desde el año de 1492 hasta el de 1531. De cada primera al Rey Nu[est]ro Señor." Each volume (8 "decades" and Descripción de las Indias Ocidentales) has special engraved t.p.  Engraved borders on title pages incorporate portraits of Inca leaders and prominent Spaniards, New World landscapes and historical vignettes. The first 4 decades and the Descripción were printed in 1601 by Juan Flamenco. The last 4 decades, continuing the history from 1532 to 1554, were printed in 1615 by Juan de la Cuesta. Most text is printed in columns. Woodcut initials, head pieces, tail pieces. The Descripción is bound in following the 4th decade. Palau y Dulcet (2. ed.) vol. 6, p. 581, # 114286 Sabin vol. 8, p. 245, # 31544 Descripción Phillips, 1141 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. LC Copy 1 trimmed to 28 cm. Has handwritten marginalia throughout, mostly English translations of words and phrases in the Spanish text. Has ink stamp: Library of Congress, 1867. Kislak accession no.: 1987.054.01.0001. Kislak accession no.: 1987.054.02.0001. Kislak accession no.: 1987.054.03.0001. Kislak accession no.: 1987.054.04.0001. LAC ael 2019-06-19 no edits (2 cards)

call_number: F1411 .H6 1601 Copy 2. In full mottled calf with raised bands and gold tooling on spine. Watermarks apparent on flyleaf or pastedown of each volume. Provenance: Gift of Jay I. Kislak Foundation.

G1100 .H4 1601 Copy 3. Atlas only. 96 p., 14 maps (some folded), 28 cm. Scales differ. Includes map showing parts of eastern Asia and Indonesia. 2 maps mounted on cloth. Annotations in ink in English on p. 8.
contributors: Jay I. Kislak Collection (Library of Congress)
created_published: En Mad[rid] : En la Emprenta Real, 1601-15.

description: Title provided by cataloger. Shows the vicinity of Bismarck with the locations of Fort Abraham Lincoln and cavalry quarters labeled. Relief shown by hachures. Pen-and-ink on paper. Mounted on cloth. Oriented with north to the right. Note on verso in different hand: From the private papers of Rufus King who was secretary to Rutherford B. Hayes. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. vcFY24

description: Shows the Crown Point-Eureka mines in the Wardner District in Shoshone County, Idaho. Red, blue, and black pen-and-ink on paper. Oriented with north to the bottom. Includes inset map of the Wardner District and a vertical profile of the Crown Point-Eureka mines. Reproduced as a traced map: Plan and section. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. vcFY24

description: Shows lots and names of landowners. Pen-and-ink (red). Title supplied by cataloger. Both maps dirty and stained. Smaller scale map heavily annotated with pencil throughout. description: Shows geological cross sections (vertical profiles) of the gold mining regions in the approximate area between San Francisco, Sacramento, and the Sierra Nevada range. Relief shown by hachures on Plate VII. Title provided by cataloger. Pen-and-ink on paper. Maps marked with plate number in upper right corner. Plate I contains watermark: J Whatman, Turkey Mill, 1848 Plate II and Plate VIII are water stained and tearing along sheet edges. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. vcFY24

contents: Pl. I. Geological section from Bodega Bay to the Sierra Nevada, about N. 80° E. -- Pl. II. Geological section from San Francisco to the Sierra Nevada, about N. 70° E. -- Pl. III. Geological sections in the gold region of the Sierra Nevada -- Pl. IV. Geological section in the gold region from the Yuba to Coloma, about S. 40° E. -- Pl. V. Geological section in the gold region from the Cosumes to the Calaveras, about S.S.E. -- Pl. VI. [Cross sections of two valleys] -- Pl. VII. Survey of public lands in the gold region -- Pl. VIII. Geological section at Bodega Point, about E. -- Pl. IX. Natural cross-section in veins of gold-bearing quartz: referred to at p.
medium: 9 manuscript maps on 11 sheets ; 15 x 91 cm or smaller + text (1 sheet ; 21 cm)
notes: Shows geological cross sections (vertical profiles) of the gold mining regions in the approximate area between San Francisco, Sacramento, and the Sierra Nevada range.
Relief shown by hachures on Plate VII.
